titlestmt.titleproper: A Finding Aid to the Sylvia Snowden Papers, 1962-2017, in the Archives of American Art
titlestmt.author: Rayna Andrews
titlestmt.sponsor: Funding for the processing of this collection was provided by the Henry Luce Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-08-24 13:21:08 -0400.

did.abstract: The papers of African American abstract painter Sylvia Snowden measure 1.7 linear feet and date from 1962 to 2017. The collection contains biographical material, including recorded interviews with Snowden; correspondence; material related to professional activities, including exhibitions and symposia; printed material; and photographic material, as well as one sketch.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research. Access to original papers requires an appointment and is limited to the Archives' Washington, D.C. Research Center.
Researchers interested in accessing born-digital records or audiovisual recordings in this collection must use access copies. Contact Reference Services for more information.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The papers of African American abstract painter Sylvia Snowden measure 1.7 linear feet and date from 1962 to 2017. The collection contains biographical material, including recorded interviews with Snowden, resumes and chronologies, and certificates; correspondence with galleries and museums including M. Hanks Gallery and the Corcoran Gallery of Art; material related to professional activities, including exhibitions and symposia, and related audiovisual and born-digital materials; printed material, including exhibition invitations, exhibition catalogs, calendars, clippings, and magazines; and a small amount of photographic material, as well as one sketch.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Sylvia Snowden (1942- ) is an African American abstract painter in Washington, D.C. known for her large mixed-media works that convey a sense of texture or the "feel of paint."

Snowden earned both a Bachelor and a Master of Fine Arts degree from Howard University. She also attended Skowhegan School of Painting and Sculpture in Maine and earned a certificate from le Grande Chaumi√®re in Paris, France. She has served as an instructor, visiting lecturer, panelist, and artist-in-residence at universities, galleries, and art schools across the country and internationally. Her work has been included in exhibitions at the National Gallery of Art, the Corcoran Gallery of Art, the National Museum of Women in the Arts, Parish Gallery, and the California African American Museum; as well as in exhibitions in Chile, the Netherlands, Ethiopia, Australia, the Bahamas, France, Mexico, Italy, and Japan.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The Sylvia Snowden papers were donated in 2019 by Sylvia Snowden, as part of the Archives' African American Collecting Initiative funded by the Henry Luce Foundation.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is arranged as five series.

list.item: Series 4: Printed Material, 1964-2017 (Boes 1-3, OV 4; 0.9 linear feet)
Series 5: Photographic Material and Artwork, 1989-2005 (Box 3; 0.1 linear feet)

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The Archives of American Art makes its archival collections available for non-commercial, educational and personal use unless restricted by copyright and/or donor restrictions, including but not limited to access and publication restrictions. AAA makes no representations concerning such rights and restrictions and it is the user's responsibility to determine whether rights or restrictions exist and to obtain any necessary permission to access, use, reproduce and publish the collections. Please refer to the Smithsonian's Terms of Use for additional information.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Sylvia Snowden papers, 1962-2017. Archives of American Art, Smithsonian Institution.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The collection was minimally processed and a finding aid prepared by Rayna Andrews in 2021 with funding from the Henry Luce Foundation.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains an address list; certificates; recorded interviews on VHS and a transcript of an interview with Sylvia Snowden that originally aired on NPR's All Things Considered; and copies of Snowden's resume and chronologies of her exhibitions.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes certificate from Acad√©mie de la Grande Chaumi√®re and certificate of appreciation from the Anacostia Museum.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains Snowden's correspondence with galleries and museums, including M. Hanks Gallery and the Corcoran Gallery of Art.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes correspondence related to Snowden's exhibition, Malik Farewell, Till We Meet Again. Also includes a lsit of artwork loaned to the Corcoran.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Also includes printed material.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes photocopies of works written by Wilson.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Also includes photocopy of guest book for Abstract in Black exhibition at School 33 Art Center.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Included in this series are materials related to Sylvia Snowden's exhibitions, speaking engagements, and fellowships. Also included are materials related to sale of her work and teaching at the University of the District of Columbia. Files may contain correspondence, contracts, invoices, printed material, and photographs. This series also includes audiovisual and born-digital material.

scopecontent.p: Includes application materials, as well as financial documentation for grant period.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: One tape labeled "Malik Farewell Sylvia Snowden Corcoran Gallery." Unlabeled cassettes include one television segment about the exhibition and one other recording that appears to be at the gallery.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes price lists, list of selected exhibitions, and printed material. Portfolio discs contain artist statement, curriculam vitae, images, and a slideshow.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes personnel and payment forms; memos and correspondence; and academic calendar.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series includes calendars, clippings, announcements and invitations to Sylvia Snowden exhibitions, exhibition catalogs, magazines, newsletters, and press releases.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes Skowhegan School of Painting & Sculpture bulletin, brochure, and alumni newsletter.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This small series includes photographs, negatives, and slides of Snowden's artwork and of an exhibition, likely Malik Farewell, Till We Meet Again. Also included is one unidentified sketch.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photographs of guests viewing exhibition, likely Malik Farewell, Till We Meet Again.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes photographs, slides, and negatives.
